SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
ENABLEMENT SITES (MYTRAILHEAD)
Enablement Sites (myTrailhead)

Deliver your company’s unique enablement content through a branded experience powered by the Trailhead online learning platform.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions
NOTE Since February 2022, parts of the enablement site workflow have had a few label changes. We've updated some terminology in Trailmaker and in this help, but previous terminology can still appear in Salesforce, this help, and other resources such as Trailhead and Salesforce Knowledge. See Terminology Changes from myTrailhead to Enablement Sites.
Enablement Sites Rollout Guide
Get started with enablement sites (formerly myTrailhead) and deliver your company’s unique learning content through a branded experience powered by the Trailhead online learning platform.
Terminology Changes from myTrailhead to Enablement Sites
Since February 2022, parts of the enablement site workflow have had a few label changes. We've updated terminology in some parts of the user experience and help documentation.
Plan Your Enablement Site Solution
Excited to start delivering exceptional content to help employees and partners grow their expertise with your company's processes, policies, or requirements? Learn more about how an enablement site can help.
Configure Your Enablement Site
Set up the enablement site for your company, including your subdomain, authentication provider, user permissions, and brand identity.
Surface Enablement Content in the Flow of Work
Make sure that your learners can easily access your published content and start earning points and badges. You can add links to your enablement site in Salesforce, show content in the Guidance Center panel and Learning Home, and share content in Slack.
Navigate Your Enablement Site
Understand what learners experience when they log in to your enablement site and explore your trails, modules, and trailmixes.
Create Content with the Trailmaker Content App
After writers finalize your company’s learning content, move your draft to Trailmaker Content. Create metadata for the trails, modules, and units that you want to publish, and format your unit content. You also use Trailmaker Content to maintain published content.
Manage Releases with the Trailmaker Release App
Prepare, preview, and publish new or changed content for your enablement site with the Trailmaker Release app. You can also update, archive, and restore content.
Translate Enablement Site Content to Other Languages
Learners can select a different language for viewing your enablement site. To provide localized versions of your learning content for supported languages, work with a localization team or vendor.
Create and Share Custom Content Paths with Trailmixes
A trailmix is a customized learning journey that you can create for yourself or for others. You can use any enablement site or Trailhead content you like. You also can include custom steps, such as in-person activities, or links to videos and other online content.
Evaluate and Maintain Enablement Content
Keep your company’s enablement experience fresh, up to date, and purposeful. Evaluate how well your published content performs, and then update, add, or delete content as your learning and enablement strategy matures. You can also transfer your content to another system by quickly exporting all content that’s been published or archived on your enablement site.
DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
title: Enablement Sites and Custom Learning Content
